Authenticate.description: Authenticate and get a token to use with other calls. Authentication also gates any further work, to make sure we are working on behalf of an authenticated client
Authenticate.name: Authenticate

Configure Server:1.description: Push and apply Chef recipes on the server
Configure Server:1.name: Configure Server:1

Check that Environment is Ready and Serv.name: Check that Environment is Ready and Server is Up:1

Get Token.description: Get token response and write it into context
Get Token.name: Get Token

Get Keys to Inject.name: Get Keys to Inject

Register Server:0.name: Register Server:0

Prepare Overrides.description: Get all the variables we need (like database name and password) and compile them into JSON that we can set on the role or environment
Prepare Overrides.name: Prepare Overrides

Check on Registration and Overrides:1.description: Before applying chef recipes, we need to know that the server has chef on it and that the overrides (database settings) have been applied
Check on Registration and Overrides:1.name: Check on Registration and Overrides:1

Check on Registration and Overrides:0.description: Before applying chef recipes, we need to know that the server has chef on it and that the overrides (database settings) have been applied
Check on Registration and Overrides:0.name: Check on Registration and Overrides:0

Write Database Settings.description: Take the JSON prepared earlier and write it into the wordpress role. It will be used by the Chef recipe to connect to the DB
Write Database Settings.name: Write Database Settings

Wait before adding to LB:0.description: Wait for Load Balancer ID, ServiceNet IP, and for server to be fully configured before adding it to load balancer
Wait before adding to LB:0.name: Wait before adding to LB:0

Wait before adding to LB:1.name: Wait before adding to LB:1
